page.title: 15HOBBIES
page.content: In the survey we asked our classmates to write about their hobbies. Derek Anderson of primary 7 writes: 'My hobby is orienteering. I go every Thursday evening to Camphill High School to do it. You need a whistle, a pen, a compass and a map to be able to do orienteering. The object of the sport is to find your way between two places on a map. The compass is used to make sure that you can find the direction from one point to another, the pen is used to mark the route you should take on the map to get from one point to another. The whistle is a very important piece of equipment for orienteering. If you get lost you have to use the whistle to summon help. You should not get lost because to go orienteering you must first do a basic course in using a compass and reading a map.
